doc.after: The city is located along the Shatt al-Arab waterway, 55 kilometers (34Â mi) from the Persian Gulf and 545 kilometers (339Â mi) from Baghdad, Iraq's capital and largest city. Its economy is largely dependent on the oil industry. Iraq has the world's 4th largest oil reserves estimated to be more 115 billion barrels (18.3Ã10 ^9Â m3). Some of Iraq's largest oil fields are located in the province, and most of Iraq's oil exports leave from Al Basrah Oil Terminal. The South Oil Company has its headquarters in the city.
